You really get to have an impact on your employees' lives, and you can feel like you're part of a family if you stick around long enough.
cons: No home life whatsoever.  Some very hard choices have to be made at the end of the fiscal year when suddenly budgets shrink and everyone at the corporate level wants you to do more with less.  High octane, high stress environment with little to no downtime.  They give you a laptop and a cell phone and you had better be attached to them 24/7.  High turnover rate among managers, who seem to get fired extraordinarily easily.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Orlando, FL
pros: Good pay and weekly checks.
cons: Extreme working environments. Strenuous work with no break.

job_title: Senior Strategic Marketing Analyst in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Good hours/ benefits, flexible vacation time, employee discounts (airline, car purchase), workload is not difficult if you have any kind of good work ethic/ intelligence
cons: Promotions only available to IT-type people or if you kiss up to the manager, project work/ performance review system is a joke, same mundane job day in and day out, no working from home because certain people abused the privelege so now nobody can do it, incompetent management/ director, too many "lifers" that can't carry their own workload - but they are not reprimanded or fired, everyone gets the same 3% raise every year - regardless of performance, if you are a productive worker - you get rewarded with MORE WORK, and you get to do the lifer's work since they don't care to do it.

review_title: Multi-tasking, fast-paced, personable, but often too stressful
pros: Very inclusive company, positive working environment, encourages teamwork and has solid ethical enforcement. Management is selected well. Build consistent and positive relationships with regular customers, and really feel like you're helping them out with high-priority situations, from important shipments to wedding invitations and funeral memorials.
cons: Often understaffed to meet customer needs; multiple customers in different parts of the store, all needing your help at the same time when you're understaffed and have deadlines to meet for shipping AND printing needs -- very stressful. Customer Service doesn't communicate consistent protocols that retail stores need to operate under. Job is already stressful enough as is with so much multi-tasking involved, but then you're also expected to push sales of specific items each month, plus packing services (when you sometimes don't even have proper time to package items).

pros:
Promote from within
Easy to get hired
cons:
No breaks
Hard work with unreasonable expectations
NO A/C

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Charlotte, NC
pros: the pay is pretty good.
cons: it was always hot. and some of the stuff was heavy.

job_title: Senior Marketing Proj Analyst  in Memphis, TN
pros:
Great work life balance. Sr Mgmt encourages a lot of community work. 
Good pay. Cost of living is pretty low compared to major cities. Pay hikes are pretty low. 
Interesting Business problems. Constantly changing economic landscapes has us doing a lot of analytics to support business decisions. Strong analytics forms the backbone of a number of group in fedex.
Lot of focus on employee training and developing leadership. Management is very friendly and easily accessible. every major life event (marriages, birthdays, babies) are celebrated with a lot of joy. Lot of ongoing community work during office hours as part of corporate responsibility.
Very diverse culture - lots of women and minorities in the work place.
cons:
Career growth can be slow. Very few mgmt openings and too many professionals vying for them.
Company pursues too many projects and there are lot of resource issues.The operate independently model hampers a lot of initiatives. The hierarchy is pretty flat at the top and lot of issues cannot be resolved by top management due to the flat structure.
very different cultures across opcos.

review_title: Ok if you like to get burned out for little pay
job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Haven, CT
pros: Interesting people thats about it.
cons: They work you to the bone, especially during peak which usually starts end of October through end of January. Basically your there from 6am to about 7-9pm. The contractors pay about 1.25-1.50 a stop. Depending on the day you could have between 70-180 stops(stops not packages, you could have 1 stop and have 10 packages to drop off). Its great if you can work under 6-7 hours, but anything over that your about 8-9$ an hour in the end. Totally not worth it. Contractors make a lot and the more routes they own the more bling. Not sure what they got exactly but when your living in a nice 4-5 bedroom house, own/lease 3-4 luxury cars BMW, Land Rover and Mercedes and own all the toys, you must be making over 250-350k a year if not more.  Its fine if you want no life, single and like to drive around. The trucks are hot in summer and cold in the winter (if you have newer truck you should be fine).

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Olathe, KS
pros: There are no pros here
cons: Terrible environment and terrible managers.

review_title: A great company to be at!
pros: There isn't much I can't say! I've never worked for a company this amazing. I've had a lot of different jobs and coming to Fedex has been a beautiful wake up. This will be the place I retire from. 'The FedEx way' was shown to me the first two weeks in the door. 99.9 percent of people I have met have been nothing but kind and love their jobs! Resources are everywhere and encouraged to use! This company treats you like family and has strong family values. Positive encouragement is passed out on a regular basis and negativity is not welcome. The benefits are outstanding! Management and above listens to everyone and your effort is appreciated. The team activities are fun and never feel forced. I am so grateful to be part of the Fedex family. If you have the chance - don't miss out!
cons: Pay is a little low for the field. The interview process can be overwhelming and can make you almost walk away. Don't! The cons really aren't here. If the pay was a tad higher I think this company would literally be the top company to work for!

pros: Steady hours, decent health benefits.
cons: The pay situations are garbage.  I started with the company as a package handler. After getting a degree, I moved up to a Maintenance position. HR has told me that there is a "cap" as to how much you can increase pay. So I am forever below the pay rate of people who came from the outside. I've even trained new employees who started off making $4+ per hour MORE than me; just because they worked for a completely different company for 20 years (no experience in this field). FedEx can learn something from Unions. Cut & dry requirements. You can't do the job, you don't get the pay.

review_title: Still absolutely, positively after all the years
pros: Company culture is great, very positive towards customers and employees. We're all in it together. The old "absolutely, positively" ethic is still alive at FedEx. Cost of living is low compared to pay for the Memphis area locations. Benefits are good, especially work life balance. My manager always says, "Work to live, don't live to work." FedEx is one of the largest shipping companies in the world, so we get to work on some of the largest, most interesting business challenges in the world.
cons: FedEx (and its divisions) are a very large, mature company. Bureaucracy is the norm for large companies. It is easy to get lost in the masses. Advancement opportunities can be hard to find in many parts of the corp, unless you have a senior manager champion who wants you promoted. There is an entrenched good-old-boy network which can be hard to crack. Look out if/when Fred Smith retires.

job_title: Cross Border E-Commerce Agent in Memphis, TN
pros:
•Interesting work
•Relaxed environment 
•Rapport among coworkers
cons:
•Overstaffed
•Work is repetitive
•False 
•Poor communication and consistency from management 
•Less than adequate business resources and aid materials
•Noticeable gap between high performers and others yet no rewards for those that perform at a higher level or go above and beyond 
•Holidays were taken away, and, at times, overtime is mandated  
•Favoritism shown by management 
•Pay is not as high as similar positions in other companies
•No opportunities for advancement in company
•Special projects only given to select group of people
•Lack of true management on certain shifts

pros: None sucks cart bananas foot
cons: Working there all day every day pizza

job_title: Technical Advisor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great company. I was proud to work for them. However, I think it is built on the back of the couriers, pilots, and hub people and delivers packages on time despite current poor IT support.
cons: The company has become mired in the mud due to new processes implemented over the last few years. It is impossible to get anything done for the users. Small fixes take an act of Congress to load to production, much more than they are worth. So anything but the most fatal of errors is never scheduled for work. Paperwork occupies most of a developers time. Don't go there if you like to make things *work* for your users.

job_title: Ramp Agent in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: There are some good attributes to working for FedEx when you are part time.  For example you will have 2 personals, 2 floating holidays, and 2 weeks vacation, 401k and health benefits.
cons: I have worked at several locations at my current 11 years, and the one things that all of them have in common is that the ramp agents are abused on a daily basis.  As a ramp agent your are responsible for running the sort and have almost 4 pages of job responsibilities for a whopping 15:85 an hour starting with a 30 cent raise every year.  You are responsible for keeping handlers in line, but you can't fire or discipline them but you are responsible for their actions and held 100% accountable.

pros: The people are amazing. Management really cares about their people, helping them to learn and grow. What you think is really hard is not. I left seeking more money. I work twice the hours with less appreciation and the work is so much harder. At some point you have to decide what is important. If it is family and security with work/life balance and a place that encourages great customer service and volunteerism - stay at FedEx! I had 6 weeks vacation that I was encouraged to use. I will never ever get that again.
cons: When you have been here for 10 years you see other, "newer models" coming in and making more money than you do. It is really discouraging. All I wanted was market value for my hard work and couldn't get it. They backfilled my position, turned over two people and then ended up paying more than what I asked for.

pros: It is like being part of a professional sports team at FedEx Ground. Management doesn't force too much down your way, but you are an essential cog of the wheel. It is an easy job to get, but it takes art and strength to keep it past even the trial period. If you get good and do it correctly, it is a great exercise.
cons: The primary position requires that you scan 300 barcodes an hour and lift 70 lbs. quite regularly and if you can't take that you will not be around long. Most people actually do make it. There are sirens and the constant noise of the conveyor, earplugs might save the valuable hairs of your inner ear.

pros: Solid company to work for, competitive base salary compared to some other sales roles, good culture overall, ramp up period is understanding that there's going to be a learning curve. Travel benefits are very unique and cool.
cons: Bonus (commission) structure is confusing and often you have little control over whether your customers ship more, less, or the same. You could have an amazing quarter with on-boarding new business and not make a bonus check because 1 or 2 of your customers changed the way they billed their shipments. Salespeople are not always rewarded for their efforts. Company has no flexibility with working from home or conducting meetings via online or phone - everything must be done in person every day of the week.

pros: it suck really bad bad
cons: i will never work there again

review_title: Other than keeping your Job, working hard doesn't benefit you here.
pros: Money was good for what you were doing. You get a raise for just staying for longer than a month. Job is very easy mentally, you just put boxes on a belt. Your work days never changed, so you always knew your schedule. Management were lenient when asking for days off.
cons: Managers were nice one day, but very rude and disrespectful the next. Managers in a sense are slave drivers, meaning no matter how ahead of schedule or how hard you work, they wanted you to work harder. Managers get angry if you start to slow down slightly after lifting 50 Ib boxes straight for two hours. Overall just a lot of disrespect and lack of constructive motivation from managers. Aside from management, working there in winter is bitter cold. The job is also very repetitive.

pros: They provide marketing and business for your delivery business.
cons: Fedex continually increases the delivery load and other responsibilities they place upon the contractors in order to increase their profits, without any concern whatsoever for how it affects the contractors.  In fairness to local management, they probably have their hands tied as more and more volume is generated in their area without the terminal being awarded adequate PSA's to cover it, so they are forced to either run supplemental routes which mean additional payroll, rental, insurance, and fuel expenses, or their drivers end up working past the hours allowed by DOT.

pros: Work life balance is required, most managers are really nice and understanding. Benefits are good, standby flight benefits on all airlines.
cons: If you are unable or don’t want to move from Dallas, consider your career dead. There are virtually no positions to promote to, and too many politics and higher ups with power struggles. Unable to control your numbers, it seems like they draw names from a hat to see who gets a bonus, internal issues are unreal for a company this size. The director is a nightmare, she is anti-family, anti-team work, if she had it her way we would be glued to our desks all day. They also changed the bonus payout and they don’t care how that money affects our families.

pros:
- Deep corporate resources for equipment, supplies, job tools
- Good education benefits
- Good bonuses (if the company is doing well)
- Tries to improve
- Has some agile, intelligent, hard-working employees
cons:
- Moves ponderously slowly (if at all) on intelligent suggestions from the experts the company employs
- Misses ENORMOUS money-making opportunities because of management turf wars
- Moves lightning-fast on pet projects promoted by upper management
- Wastes money investing in poorly managed and under-analyzed initiatives
- Terrible at follow-through on long-term projects
- Terrible at internal communications (can be very "siloed")
- You need to be excellent at tooting your own horn to advance
- Annual employee reviews are more a matter of defending yourself rather than collaborating with management and documenting your successes and learning experiences
- Awards and advancement can be based on favoritism and the "halo" effect
- Management quality is spotty
- Has shockingly few safeguards/redundancies in place to ensure quality/thoroughness of work

pros: Fed Ex gives students like me the flexibility to be a full time student, while working part time and having all of the perks of a full time employee. Not to many jobs out there will give you full benefits (health, dental, vision)from the day you start. Fed Ex helps with tuition reimbursement (up to $3,000 per year).  You also get flight benefits if you are over the age of 21 years old, and have been with the company up to 6 months. The flight benefits allowed me to travel to places through any airline at 75% off the total cost of any plane ticket.
cons: Fed Ex is an extremely physical job, with high risks of injury day in and day out if not cautions at all times. The entry level pay can be a higher for the amount of work provided. Starting pay is not far from minimum wage in the Bay Area.

pros: There were no pros working there
cons: unprofessional manager, very low hours

pros: Good time off to be with family
cons: Bad management and mangers that’s

review_title: Great place to work with a lot of flexibility
pros: Lots of flexibility on hours, relocation, and promotion.  Generally good people and a world-class service brand.  I had worked for the "major competitor" for many years, and found the FedEx workplace and culture to be much more open and motivated.
cons: Work ethic tends to be somewhat lax.   Customer service is given a lot of lip service, but many employees and managers find excuses to cut corners at the expense of the customer.   Training is somewhat lax, and employee performance could be improved if methods and accountability were of a higher standard.   But again, I came from "the Other Company" where standards were higher....  The best employees at FedEx are those who are self-directed and have high personal standards.  Management won't hold you to high standards unless they themselves have them.

review_title: One of the best big companies to work for
pros: FedEx people are pleasant to work with. The company does things to offer a lot of training and development for its employees. They put more into training and development than other company I've worked for. They also are very diverse and believe in putting high quality people in positions to succeed. The benefits are also excellent, particularly if you live in Memphis.
cons: To move far up the ladder, you'll have to live in Memphis, TN at some point. And if you're from a big city environment, or like having lots of cultural things to do, you probably won't be thrilled to live there. However, if you tend to throw your life into your work, then that might be a good thing because you won't have many distractions (if you're from a small town or like a slower pace of life, it's perfect). The company is also conservative, bureacratic, methodical, and tends to move slow. If you are used to fast-paced, wheeling and dealing companies where you don't need multiple levels of approvals for things, then this might not be for you.

pros: Good for student without a responsibility, most of the jobs are part time. Excessive use of temporary hand workers instead of part timers. Non unionized. Benefits if you get a PPT. IF.
cons:
No movement between divisions; you are stuck. 
The different divisions (Express, Office, Ground, Custom critical...) behave as silos, same as each country where it works. Open the doors of the cross training an use the resources without borders.  Difficult to grow and closed groups handle the development. Too much overhead in operations. 
Poor use of technology. FedEx operations is just labor. Non unionized.

review_title: Excellent place for leading a comfortable life
pros:
- Most people work 30-35 hrs per week
- High job security 
- Good work environment
- Nice team work culture
cons:
- Salary is just comfortable and mostly the same for high, low and mediocre performers
- There is no career growth path
- Very low risk taking culture
- Every job is posted and people are interviewed. People who want to move forward spend more than half their time networking and other half creating interview packets. Promotion or career advancement is probably 20% dependent on skill and 80% on networking.
- Without promotions, which take on average about 5-10 years, the annual raises are about 1-3%. Yes the range is difference between significantly exceeding expectations and not meeting expectations

review_title: Hey, it's a job. You could be doing a lot worse...
job_title: Fed Ex Courier in Derwood, MD
pros:
Decent benefits. 
As a courier you get to meet new people everyday. 
On great weather days, you're outside and enjoying the sun.
cons:
No Union for couriers because of some governmental loophole FedEx has been able to take advantage of.
 It'll take you 15+ years to get to top pay as a courier,which is in the neighborhood of $29hr. ( compare it to UPS which is Union, their top pay is at $33hr+ and achieved at approx. 4-5 years)
Until then, be ready to put in as much overtime as you possibly can if available. 
Several couriers moonlight for Uber just to be able to make ends meet

Also, FedEx "Ground" and " Home Delivery" contracted drivers (not actual FedEx employees) with their lack of professionalism and work ethic that tarnish the FedEx name. 
The ISP model at Ground and Home Delivery is bad for company image, but great for the bottom line.

pros: Amazing benefits go well beyond health care, includes 24/7 Nurse on call. Also work/Life Balance counselors. Too much to list here.  Retiree benefits are also wonderful as long as you are 55 yrs. and have 20 yrs with company. Make a career with FedEx and you can be financially secure when you retire. Part time employees entitled to healthcare benefits, 401k, pension and life insurance just as full time employees. Great opportunity for growth and movement throughout the company and the country should you ever want to relocate.
cons: Shift work in certain positions that can be very disruptive to healthy sleep. No time off during "Peak" season. Generally Dec 1, through Dec 26.  Also when you have off for a Holiday,  generally scheduled to work much earlier the day after because freight is behind by a day. If you are young and looking for a career with security, growth and very fair wages,  FedEx is worth looking in to. Older people and disabled not so much.

pros: They have very good benefits
cons: They don’t care for their employees.

review_title: Put the "People" back in the PSP!!!
pros: job security, freedom to do my job,
cons: no time for a personal life. 12-13 hours spent at FedEx every day leaves no time to unwind and come to work the next day all rested and ready to go.

job_title: IT Project/Process Advisor in Thousand Oaks, CA
pros: Puts employees FIRST. I love that the founder makes it a priority to recognize the employees as being the reason for company success. Several perks, and programs are available to ensure we are taken care of. Pay is good, morale is good! I am still considered a “puppy” with “ONLY” 17yrs here!! There is a reason folks stay- we bleed purple. Amazing company to work for. It’s an honor and privilege!
cons: Very hard to be a remote employee in IT because it isn’t the norm in the dept I am in. I do understand that I have to work even harder to stay visible- but that also means my manager and team also needs to make sure they include me in communications and meetings. Kinda hard to be involved if I’m not being told what’s going on... but it’s still new to allow remotes, so I’m sure it will get better

review_title: Dont work too hard, previous store manager
job_title: Senior Store Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: If you're under the right manager, you'll learn and promote fast. The pay is great coming in as a external hire, which sucks for people who have there for years because 9 times outta 10 you are making more than them and THEY are training you. Their benefit packages are great, vacation, sick days, floating holidays, 401k, medical and dental. You can grow with the company.
cons: They will fire you quickly! There is no loyalty, doesnt matter if you've been there 5 days, 5 years or 25 years they will get rid of you. Like I mentioned before new external hires are coming in making more than current employees which has brought down the moral. It's a very fast paced environment and they aspect soo much of you, sometimes the pay doesnt seem worth it. The com6is CONSISTENTLY rolling out new procedures and products so you always have to make sure you are on top of it, because if you're not they will discipline you.

pros: Great pay for the area. I am very happy with how I am treated at FedEx. FedEx has a pension plan that is very nice. The pension plan is a portable pension plan, which means I keep it even if I leave the company; however, I have no plans to leave. The IT market in Memphis is very poor right now. I feel lucky to be at FedEx during such hard times. Hilton, Internation Paper, Service Master, and Harrah's Entertainment all seems to making big cut backs, including layoffs. It seems that the only IT jobs left in Memphis are contract jobs.
cons: It is hard to make a name for yourself and stand out. Great pay for the area. I am very happy with how I am treated at FedEx. FedEx has a pension plan that is very nice. The pension plan is a portable pension plan, which means I keep it even if I leave the company; however, I have no plans to leave. The IT market in Memphis is very poor right now. I feel lucky to be at FedEx during such hard times. Hilton, Internation Paper, Service Master, and Harrah's Entertainment all seems to making big cut backs, including layoffs.

review_title: Quality Driven Management - Make it Work!
job_title: Senior Marketing Specialist in Collierville, TN
pros: Fred Smith knows what he's doing.  He has based FedEx on the People-Service-Profit premise that if you take care of your people, they will provide the service needed and the profit will come.  He actually wants to take care of his employees and customers.
cons: Unfortunately, too many in management/senior management are more interested in their next promotion or how to obtain a 5-Star than they are in doing right things right the first time.  Fred's renewed emphasis on Quality is falling on deaf ears in the management and senior management ranks.  They are using the ready-fire-aim method rather than assess-build-launch-evaluate.

pros: Much of the job is autonomous at times. If you can penetrate a key account with a competitor and switch them you'll likely enjoy solid commissions for several quarters. Very good reimbursement for  expenses: car, mileage etc. Solid base pay.
cons: Tedious admin work- almost daily. Endless reports and reports of reports. New action items. Working for an enormous company there is significant projections to have for management weekly. Many of these mundane tasks interfere with the true role of the job- SALES! Account maintenance and service takes up a significant amount of time.

job_title: Courier/Customer Agent in Palo Alto, CA
pros: Perfect for the single guy.
cons: It's very hard to move up in this company if you have been there for a while. If you have aspirations of moving up , you will need to do it within the first 3 to 5 years otherwise it will be a hard struggle up.  Management there is not so professional either! Just research and look at all the lawsuits that have been filed against FedEx in the past 8 yrs! I knew someone who tried to move up for over a year and was stuck doing work for his manager without anything to really show for it. He came close to getting fired for getting an injured doing his job.  He eventually was forced to relocate or be out of a job.

review_title: Ethical company poised for continued growth
pros: If you are willing to move to Memphis, there are lots of opportunities to grow your career.  The leadership team is made up of employees who grew through the ranks so they know the business intimately and can relate to employees. I really like the senior leadership team -- they are ethical and easy to talk to because they listen to you regardless of your position in the company.
cons: They are very slow to move sometimes and it feels like everything down the most minute internal memo requires legal review. There is a distinct "Memphis-centric" sense to the mid-level business partners - as though if you are out in the field, you need to prove yourself that much harder because they are skeptical that anybody else can do what they do.

pros:
FedEx is an excellent brand name offering decent pay with fair benefits, paid time off, retirement, profit sharing.
It is an excellent part time job while going to school and there are many advancement opportunities for those willing to move around.
cons: Benefits have been greatly diluted over the years. The traditional retirement is gone, pay did not keep up with society, jumpseat priveleges were abandoned, pay for performance and other benefits were diluted. The people, service, profit cornerstone was abandoned for profit, profit, profit. Long term employees are greatly disillusioned by the company. Management does not support the workforce.  No longer can you be assured of a job merely by being a conscientious hard worker.

job_title: Account Executive in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
-High base salary, especially if you stay with company and promote to senior sales executive.  
-Job Security
-Brand Recognition
-If you are willing to relocate there are many options for promotions
-Home office, set your own schedule (to an extent)
cons:
-Daily/weekly face to face call requirement is ridiculous (6/day; 30/week)
-More "customer service" than sales; too much admin work  
-Bonus is based on overall territory performance, not a lot of control as a rep on shipping needs of customers.  If customer business needs change and they don't need to ship as much, rep is negatively affected.
-Lots of internal issue with accounts being misaligned to wrong rep, this benefits some, and detrimental to others in terms of territory goal attainment and bonuses paid. 
-You can work really hard and not get paid, or you can not work hard and get paid, seems like a coin flip at times. 
-For the amount of work you do, the compensation (bonuses) really isn't that great.

review_title: Lots of cover ups from management
pros: The people on the dock and the drivers are a ball to be around. The teamwork that goes on to load and unload trailers. The lead supervisors on the dock are people persons.
cons: Things that go on that get covered up would never happen elsewhere. Pulling trailers away from the dock with someone in it someone said the person was in training when in fact two other people were trained after this person. Opening a Fulltime positon and giving it to someone that took a sevrence left for a year and came back as a supplemental dockworker.Thats Just Wrong...

review_title: Lots of cover ups from management
pros: The people on the dock and the drivers are a ball to be around. The teamwork that goes on to load and unload trailers. The lead supervisors on the dock are people persons.
cons: Things that go on that get covered up would never happen elsewhere. Pulling trailers away from the dock with someone in it someone said the person was in training when in fact two other people were trained after this person. Opening a Fulltime positon and giving it to someone that took a sevrence left for a year and came back as a supplemental dockworker.Thats Just Wrong...

review_title: New Accounts Setup and Specialized Call Routing
pros:
The position is work from home.
Good benefits.
LWOP means you can ask to take hours off on any given day and it does not go against your attendance. It is offered pretty frequently.
cons:
Even though you are a "specialty" department you are paid the same as a regular CSR.
You are eligible for a raise only once each year and the amount is incredibly low. I was the top rep in my department, getting the highest scores you could possibly get and received an 11 cent raise. 
Management is not effective and does not even attempt to fix or address some issues.
There is a large amount of contractors and it makes your job more difficult.

pros: Im my honesty opinion i do love the company, I'm able to get my products before the delivery ( because i work there), shipping is Much Cheaper, great environment, management is understanding and willing to actually work with you in almost any situation thinkable, were always changing and updating things, food parties if we have a good week and since I'm still in school working at night is a god send because i have all day to myself. If you love to workout this place will give you a good workout. but the best thing about this place is that they choose workers for management before looking outside the company!!
cons: probably could be a bit better pay for certain situations ( taking on multiple rolls in the company like me), and making the environment a little more fun i guess you could say (more so making the workers feel better as they work)

review_title: Decent compensation, lots of attitude from management
pros:
- Pay and benefits are quite competitive in the entry level positions.
- Direct management/supervisor is often quite congenial.
- Training received may be useful in other jobs/careers.
cons:
- A company that is very good at superficially making it appear it cares about its entry-level workers but in reality treats them like cogs in a machine.  It would be helpful if they were at least honest about this.
- Extremely rude payroll staff in Tennessee you will have to make most of the phone calls to if you have a problem, despite this being presumably HR's job.
- Senior management can be quite strange and hostile, making arbitrary rules for little to no reason that benefit no one other than a select few.

pros: You get to become connected with the business community and go behind the scenes to see what goes on in the warehouse, on the dock, manufacturing areas, production, etc.  Very fascinating stuff goes on behind otherwise normal looking front doors.
cons: Enormous bureaucracy  - it's very difficult to make progress.  No career progression unless you want to move to Memphis.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Ocala, FL
pros: I love the work. It's like getting paid to exercise. After you hit 1,000 hours, you qualify for very inexpensive, very awesome health, vision and dental benefits. After 3 months of employment you have access to PTO, which is pretty great. It's very laid back in terms of work attire (you can basically wear anything you'd like) and I like that it's kind of a "locker room" environment in the hub. No one is going to bat an eye if you drop the F bomb. Lol.
cons: Not a very liveable wage, and outside of peak season the hours can be very meager and inconsistent. If they have to many people and not enough packages, they start sending people home early for the shift/sort. It can be very hard on the body, very dangerous and rigorous.

review_title: Good company for long term career
pros: The base salary is good. Benefits for senior professionals include a vehicle (not fuel though). The medical insurance plan is good as is their retirement plan. The company philosophy of "People-Service-Profit" (in that order) is part of the oganizational culture and fabric. The work/life balance is excellent and allows for remote work from home. Management is fair.  The organization offers very diverse opportunities for a project manager. It's a good place for a long term career.
cons: Their bonus opportunity is not that great. Company cars do not include fuel costs. Their philosophy of putting people first has its drawbacks as perception management is a key skill for management (and project managers) to master. The functional organization structure and culture of silos can be complex to overcome for a project manager. Being an American based organization you may be required to work early evenings from time to time depending on the project. Staff turnover is low which does require one to have patience if professional advancement is an objective.

review_title: One of Memphis' best employers, rated in the top 100 places to work in IT
job_title: Senior Technical Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: co-workers are great, immediate management is good, health benefits are good for a family
cons: salary is lower here than other parts of the country due to a bit lower cost of living, benefits are slowly being chipped away at, some subtle, traditional pension no longer offered, first ever pay cut in 2008 of 5% (more counting no bonus and no 401K matching that was stopped for a while) never restored despite better company performance a few years later.  jumpseat flying taken away.  parts of the city and some surrounding suburbs are going downhill as the city annexes more areas

job_title: Senior Account Executive in Orlando, FL
pros: The brand is second to none, the service is second to none and the employees are second to none.  Our customer are top priority from the janitors to the CEO.  We all share the same vision and as a result we are able to focus on our customers.  I would be willing to bet that if asked every single employee could tell you what their purpose is and why.  I would also be willing to be that the answer would always end with a customer driven purpose.  We know why we are here.  It isnt about us.
cons: It is a very long day. When you strive for perfection which the company and the employees do there are frustrating moments when something goes wrong.  Weather, technology blips.  We dont want unsatified customers.  We are in the business of delivering packages not bad news.  We have long days because we want the customer to be able to go home on time.

job_title: PM Courier in Costa Mesa, CA
pros:
Good Health insurance coverage and price. About $400/mo for Kaiser, dental and vision for family coverage.
Pretty good compensation for the work.  Chances for advancement, if you have a flexible schedule.  Ability to transfer to different locations.  Advancement seems to have slowed down, due to FedEx being a mature company, and slowing of business.  There do seem to be a lot of people that have been there 20-25 years, so there may be better chances of advancement in the near future.  Good place for people without a degree to make an okay living.  Good for people looking for part-time and benefits.  Company has matching 401k and pension plan.
cons: Can be difficult scheduling vacations, days off.  Having to work holidays. Varied schedule.  Vacations needs to be scheduled a year in advance and taken in 5 day blocks, which makes it difficult to schedule days off if you have kids involved in activities you want to go to.  Time off is based on availability and seniority.

review_title: Package Handler @ 8951 Yosemite Street Henderson, CO 80640
pros:
-You get paid every week
-Flexible hours
-Initial training program was nice (it's a shame nobody actually uses what they teach in these programs)
cons:
-They will work you until you faint
-Managers tried to stop me from hydrating myself on several occasions
-The job description is a lie, they will make you handle packages heavier than 100 pounds by yourself
-Coworkers have no respect for management and vice versa, show up late and under appreciate the work coworkers do
-Environment is dirty and unsafe, had a rat problem, trash piled up in areas
-Managers create an unfriendly environment with their inappropriate language and intimidating behavior
-Did not pay enough and sorely lacked staff
-Broken equipment and facility was falling apart
-Would not allow phones in facility (wonder why... could it be they don't want people taking pictures/recording video?)
-NOBODY FOLLOWED POLICY!!!! (stepped on boxes, sorted incorrectly, drug use, etc.)

review_title: Not Bad! Easy to get job!
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Norcross, GA
pros: Easy Application, Quickly hired you after observation and fill the application, All of you will get hired no matter what if you have experience or not but important that you have a transportation to work from home. Flexible with schedule or you can arrive late but you must call advance one hour prior work start! Awesome!
cons: Last minutes to informs you the schedule to start work, Manager will yelled at you daily, push you to rush & work hardest.  Hell to work! Because you will have to pick up 0.01 lbs- 150lbs or more.  Very strict with tardy and absent if you do. Possible to get termination or ask you resign.

pros: The work is quite simple most of the time. You get to set your own pace, work as hard as you want and finish early; or take your time and cruise through the day. It really depends on the location, or the boss you work for, but most of the time, the workload is fairly reasonable. Also, most of the actual job takes place outdoor, so that can be a positive or negative depends on the person. The pay was fair for the work involved, and most of the time the equipment are well maintained and suited for the job. The job also doesn't demand much of customer interaction if you're not comfortable doing that kind of things.
cons: The workload is very erratic, there's almost never a normal workday; especially around the holidays. The time you start actually working depends very much on the people who work in the office and handle your paperwork. A majority of time, you will be working by yourself, so if you run into any problem, it's usually all up to you to solve it.

review_title: Hard work but good benefits.  Advancing takes a while.  High starting pay.
pros: Good benefits even if part time.  Medical and retirement are included.  Lots of coworkers are friendly and work hard. A better than average work environment.  Only dont miss work and keep the fast pace.  It becomes easier as you go. Overtime is available to all.
cons: Aching body, early start, they always want you there no matter what, you will be tired a lot. Asking for advancing opportunities is not well seen if you have not been there for a year. Beware of the few people who will purposely give you bad advice or try to sabbotage you.  Some people might find the higher pay not worth it for the level of effort. If not athletic this will be your only job as you are left exhausted.

pros: Working for FedEx i learned about different services fed ex has to offer such as printing services such as over size prints which are posters, banners, rigid signs, business cards etc. FedEx specializes in signs ad graphics as well as shipping giving customers a variety of options to choose from.
cons: The downside of working for fed ex is, fed ex considers a full time position 30 hours a week never more, which i disagree with most employers i have worked for in the past 40 hours is considered full-time. Along with little to no appreciation for the hard work you provide in your center it sometimes is over bearing being employed there. It can be difficult to balance a job there and everyday life and you need balance  its very important.

job_title: Senior Programmer Analyst in Collierville, TN
pros:
- Dev equipment was decent.
- Great bonus structure for top performance.
- It is really difficult to get fired.
- Decent benefits.
- Pay is on par with industry standards.
- The campus is really nice.
- Volunteer work for charity.
cons:
- It is really hard to get fired so you have to deal with dead weight. Sometimes there are "volatile" personalities who won't be fired even with workplace violence prevention in place.
- You are in a silo so you won't have an opportunity to touch technology outside your area.
- Your skills will also atrophy due to lack of new projects.
- Work life balance is a joke if you want a decent APEX score.
- Promotions are few and far between.

review_title: People-centric, but huge and takes forever to get things done
pros: Culture is pretty people-focused. Not always, but more so than other companies. There is plenty of opportunity to move around, especially laterally. Work/ life balance is what you make it - meaning you can have a great balance if you set boundaries on your time. Also, tons of flexibility in most groups if you need to work from home occasionally,  deal with sick kids, go to doctor, etc. Generally high caliber co-workers.
cons: Huge company with lots of complicated IT systems made more so by acquisitions. So, it takes YEARS to get projects done. Also, the company is very risk averse. I worked on the same projects over and over because the company wouldn't move forward the first time on what needed to happen. Projects will often not be formally killed, but rather, slowly starved of resources over time.

review_title: Not all it's made out to be
pros: The people in my department were good people for the most part. My direct manager was one of the nicest people I've ever met that put family first in front of work even though the company does not.
cons: Compensation is awful for the work I was doing. Spent 10 years of my life there. Seven of those years I was stuck in one department trying to get out to no avail. I know the industry from start to finish but because it's divided into separate OP-Cos it's nearly impossible to switch to other positions. The corporate headquarters for ground is full of  nepotism. I would apply for jobs then later find out the people hired had little to no experience but were friends of  employees or family or attractive young women hired by male managers. Getting out was a great decision for me.

review_title: Great place overall but is becoming too slow to react and very resistant to change.
job_title: Senior Marketing Project Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Very good life/work balance, good benefits and interesting work.
cons: FedEx is no longer a young company but it has not yet learned how to deal with its age. Most decisions are still made very high up. It becomes increasingly difficult to acomplish anything due to lots of red tape and bureaucracy behind which a lot of incompetent MDs and VPs are hiding. Worse, very rarely anyone is punished for poor performance or failed projects. All that makes promotions slow and a lot of great people leave due to lack of opportunities.

pros: They paid within the industry standards, though I could never get the answer to the question if we were paid in comparison to other staff that did tracing.
cons: minimal training,  limited opportunities for advancement, favoritism, lack of management oversight, dishonesty, inadequate facilities and equipment, at times dangerous, no one available to answer human resources or benefit questions. They seem to have someone on staff who's only job is to look for ways to deny health insurance claims.

pros: They paid within the industry standards, though I could never get the answer to the question if we were paid in comparison to other staff that did tracing.
cons: minimal training,  limited opportunities for advancement, favoritism, lack of management oversight, dishonesty, inadequate facilities and equipment, at times dangerous, no one available to answer human resources or benefit questions. They seem to have someone on staff who's only job is to look for ways to deny health insurance claims.

pros: Great benefits, lateral moves are possible, pension plan that few companies have, job stability, once you are a manager you are bullet proof.  Equitable hiring practices. great company for ex-military people. Great brand recognition.  You are responsible for creating your own work/life balance.  Upper management has good vision and innovative ideas.  Never a dull moment.
cons: Terrible managers are never held accountable. Management is overwhelmingly white males. Raises never keep up with the cost of living so negotiate high when coming on-board. No real support for innovation.  Managing up is a huge burden on top of your existing work load.  Being nice or political is more important than being knowledgeable.

review_title: Mid-management Position/Hard to get things done/Close Minded
pros:
- Tuition Reimbursement, decent pay,
- Some opportunities for advancement, but only if you know how to play the political game
- Active in the community
cons:
- Salary range just the average even if you are a rock star. 
- So many restrictions to avoid lawsuits often impossible to get things done and can't get paid what you're worth. I had a 'lifer' who would literally sleep at his desk and I still couldn't fire him.
- Reached a point that they were no longer innovative. After Amazon was on 60 mins saying they were looking at using drones to deliver packages in the future, the next day top leadership literally started a company-wide meeting by joking about how stupid of an idea it was (who's laughing now?)

review_title: Great job but not for everybody.
pros: When I got this job it was simply a part-time job to make ends meet right after I had my wife had our first child. With that being said, it was a great job and if you are a hard worker that shows up on time you are definitely appreciated and provided with ample opportunity to move up within the company, probably more so than any place I have ever worked.
cons: I said that it was a great job, and it is, but it certainly isn't for everyone. I was a part-time package handler and I was offered a full-time position fairly quickly. As a package handler you load or unload trucks, that are dusty as all get out, it hot and cold environments, depending on the season. The dust probably bothered me more than the heat, I'd come home and blow black snot out of my nose on a regular basis. Still a good job though.

pros: Camaraderie. Everyone becomes like family. Some coworkers you will have longer than the time youve known your spouse or longer than your kids are old. very easy to get very comfortable.
cons: the silos run very tall, very narrow, very deep. You will do one thing and one thing alone. You will not have a chance to get into anything new. Too political to move around the company. Since the 2009 layoffs and the 2013 buyouts, there has been a complete culture change. no longer people first. thats a forgotten myth. Profit, Service, people. Stock prices are at all time high, because they are screwing the employee. 7 years ago, FedEx would have gotten 5 stars. Today, they get 2 stars. They have lost their vision.

pros: Due to its long term success and market leadership the company is overall hesitant to change out of a fear that the tech is too complicated modify. For the right professional this is an excellent business  opportunity to innovate. The core business satisfies a basic public need, and the business is simple in that it is about delivering a package as quickly as possible whether its a letter or shamu the whale
cons: An understandable hesitation to change exists regardging working systems fro day operations. Even as there are aging technologies in some areas. the general managment attitude is a reluctancy to consider improvements due to complex embedded proprietary business methods

review_title: Excellent, great company to work for
job_title: Senior Strategic Marketing Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Focus on people, work/life balance, opportunities to rotate and grow, hire/promote from within, healthy team environment in most teams I have seen, good benefits, strong/stable company, very well managed (which  I particulatly saw during the 2009 economic downturn), people's opinions are sought and taken into consideration by leadership (anonymous employee surveys), opportunity for one to get stand by plane tickets (since FedEx is an airline), among many other reasons.
cons: Company grew very quickly and very big over the last 10-20 years and it's different businesess are not that well integrated (watch out that your job is not limited to a small silo.) Growth in US has been leveling off so there are not as many promotion opportunities as it used to be. There are some though and it's overall a fantastic company to work for.

pros: Meeting people & building a close relationship with regular customers is a positive with FedEx if it lasts, however the company is constantly playing games with numbers and goals by micromanaging,  that seems to bump some people from there routes, then a few months later when the big ideas / plans fail to produce any gains it goes back to the same old way, but your no longer with your old customers because you were probably forced to move or bumped
cons: unobtainable goals that have been constantly raised for more than a decade to the point you can no longer make them unless you break all the rules set in stone, break most rules of the road including that you speed thru neighborhood streets, briskly sprint up to all the homes or bussiness, and work thru most of your lunch lining up the rest of the days work on your own time i might add, just to get close to your goal to avoid the daily NOID

pros: Stable company that offers good benefits and decent pay. Upper management does a good job of making employees feel appreciated.
cons: Yearly reviews and how they are weighed changes almost yearly sometimes making it difficult to reach higher raise increases. Company mandates a lot of overtime (usually needless in my department) especially around the holidays. Usually the company offers to cut your OT hours but it makes it hard to plan things socially during this time because you don't know when or if OT will be cut.

review_title: The worst experience in my life
pros: The company have Good Benefits
cons: No Managerial support including human resources - Every departments have clicks and if you are not part of it, you will be cast as an outsider.  Most of the employees have been there    10 - 30 yrs, started in the hub or another lower paid position and think FedEx is the best job in the world. They feel if someone is hired from the outside, that person has not put there work in for the company; so the chances of advancement or slim to none  In addition, if management doesn't like you, they will falsify annual reviews, give inaccurate letters of warnings to make it look like an employee is not performing well, which are lies.   Also, managers are allowed to manage friends, so if you think about complaining, you better think twice and have you another job already lined up.  Pathetic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

job_title: Home Delivery Driver in Hickory, NC
pros: You are virtually your own boss as far as daily work is concerned.  Once you become familiar with your route you will have a shorter work day for the same pay.  If you are interested in advancing within the company , it is ground level and could be used as a spring-board into other positions.  It's a steady job.
cons: Some work days are never-endingly long.  Holidays are a time when this will absolutely be the case.  Weather and other driving irratations are part of the everyday worklife of this position.  Fellow co-workers with negative/whiny attitudes can be an issue.  Be aware you will likely be underpaid as you will be a sub-contractor.

pros: Good people work there. It’s a growing company in a growing industry, and there are opportunities.
cons: Too many to list all: Inadequate, outdated, poorly kept, and run down resources. When your competition runs a business better than the very one you started-You know it’s bad. Company founded by a marine corps pilot=company run like its the military-assignments with tons of responsibility-yet no, limited, or poor resources provided to get the job done.  Employees are expected to use personal cell phone as a job aid, yet the company offers no reimbursement for the use of a personal item for company business. Heath insurance is the worst. Provider is Cigna, which is also the worst. Vision is Davis Vision, again the worst-you’re better off going to drug store glasses-less brain damage.  Package cars are filthy. Drivers leave food in them and the rats come in the middle of the night and eat it. I’ve seen droppings in the trucks.

pros: FedEx is a satisfactory job to start with as a young person,  but beware.  It will take the average driver (courier) over ten years to "top out" at pay.  FedEx is best to be used as a job to supplement full time college courses while working towards a degree.  When said degree is achieved, run don't walk away from FedEx.
cons: Slavish work atmosphere.  Negativity at all times from management concerning your job performance.  Rampant favoritism by management towards selected employees.  Zero tolerance for mistakes.  Failure of this company to keep pace with the cost of living.  The worst couriers go into management, perpetuating the "us vs. them" (courier vs. management) mentality.  Courier pay stagnates, management pay increases.

review_title: As honestly as I can put it.
pros: Every day is the same, yet different. Once you leave the building you can sucessfully manage yourself. Great at working with communities and charities. Your success is what you make of it.
cons: You're required to load your own truck so you leave the station and greet the public sweaty and nasty. Benefits became much more expensive. You're punished if you do well by getting your delivery stops per hour (SPH) raised. You're forced to speed in order to meet your daily SPH avg. You are a human resource: If you get hurt and can't work you're discarded like a bent paper clip. Management is never satisfied with ANY results, good or bad. Couriers and lower management turnover is very high. Management is verbally abusive at times. There is no work/life balance unless you fight for it. It can be a very high pressured job.

job_title: Senior Customer Service Representative in Washington, DC
pros: Working at FedEx provided very decent wages. The company benefits allowed my girlfriend to give birth and choose which hospital to have our first child with all the advantages of prenatal care and provided "lifeworks" nurse.
cons: I have experienced unfair treatment that included several years of fighting for upgrade of my job title/status along with a pay raise accordingly. Workload distribution amongst team members was also problematic, with longer tenured employees choosing the easiest job duties with the "grunt work" assigned to the new/junior employees and still receiving comparable pay raises. All time off is scheduled on seniority basis which at times affords the longest tenured employees all the holidays and/or prime summer vacation weeks and leaves the new employees with families and kids the unappealing weeks.

pros: Nice people do work here
cons: Management has drastically changed in the last 5 years.   Fedex is no longer a company designed to take care of its employees.   They have fully endorsed moving jobs offshore regardless of performance or language ability of the contractors and have now in their new building for the DFW area shows how little they care about employees by putting in an open cube system designed to remove privacy and end any self worth of an employees that remains.   Fedex is now showing they could care less about their employees by refusing to allow hires of anyone but foreign contractors who cannot do the job forcing the rest of us to do their work on top of our own and open desk designs telling every employee that you are no longer an individual.   You are just a number to them.

review_title: FedEx:  High Employee Expectations Enhances Brand
pros: FedEx is a company that has high expectations for it's employees and is always striving for excellence.  This attitude is what enables the FedEx brand to be so well considered.  Salaries are fair and the benefits are terrific.  The fact that FedEx provides a pension for their employees demonstrates their commitment to their "People First" ideal.
cons: Too many performance metrics makes it almost impossible to get a perfect report card and can become distracting to performing the job at hand.  Lot's of time is involved outside of the office.  FedEx is not the place for a person who is only willing to work 40 hours a week.

review_title: Trustworthy company with good growth opportunities
job_title: Senior Programmer Analyst in Collierville, TN
pros: FedEx's current CEO is the original founder of the company with great dreams. This is good because the company has not lost track any time and has been very successful. The management has shown integrity and effectiveness in the past 35 years of history and is one of the virtual duopolies in the US. In the current  economic turmoil FedEx has shown tremendous strength and resorted to salary cuts and downsizing in a seemingly  fair,  controlled and minimal  way.  The company provides good opportunities for advancement and compensation and advancement are generally performance based. I have not heard of any  discrimination based on race, sexual orientation etc. in this company. In short FedEx is a reliable company with good growth opportunities.
cons: There is some red-tape and  it is probably because of the size of the company. The company is conservative and hence chances for innovation are not too many.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Collierville, TN
pros: There is minimal effort required to keep your job. There is almost no pressure to work more than 40 hours a week, and your peers are not generally terribly competitive.
cons: Very little room for professional achievement / advancement unless you are interested in management or a facsimile thereof. There are a few ("advisor") positions which might have been used for technical advancement, but as managers have been free to simply offload their own duties onto those positions, they essentially become political junior management positions themselves.

pros: Solid Fair Company.  Great branding and visualization.  It is truly wonderful to come to work where people care about one another and enjoy working together for a greater purpose, which is to service the world.  FedEx helps the Economy and we definitely do our share of supporting outside causes such as United Way.  It was absolutely amazing at how many were willing to volunteer their time and efforts this past Christmas Day and never complained about it.  We just knew it had to be done.  It made me proud that when companies are dying out there from the soft economy that our leader, Fred Smith, stood up for his company and said instead of downsizing and layoffs, we are going to take a pay decrease from my salary on down.  That shows someone who cares.
cons: It is so competitive that it is hard at times to move ahead professionally speaking.

review_title: Overall its a good company but the company lives with the success of its past.
pros: The benefits, the front line people who actually do the work are great at what they do and there is a tremendous amount of teamwork.
cons: The managment are complacent and have not initated change in operations/service offering or have no clue of what their strategy is to take on the domestic or for that matter the cross border market.  They are too cozy amongst each other and there should be change.  They live in the glory of their past, the term what got us here won't keep us here comes to mind.

pros:
Gym / workout facility
Popcorn/coffee
March of Dimes campaign
cons:
Work Life balance lie.  
50 - 75% outsourced development (India).
Complete accountability for failures (or successes) of a team 10 timezones away with a huge cultural/language barrier.

I was only there for three years.  The last 18 months were horrible.  My prior employment was 14 years with same company so I don't like to jump ship.  Our rather small team lost 11 employees in 9 months, some with over a decade at FedEx.  Two were asked to work another weekend and they unpinned their badges and left without notice.  I saw my manager and a Project Manager cry over the hours and abusive treatment of the team.  It's even worse for our Indian counterparts.  It was so bad I'd never ship with FedEx again if I have a choice.  Last, don't count on the bonuses they promise.  I found them to be much less than advertised but it's what they sell you on in the interview for their below industry average salary offering.

pros: Friendly, quick and easy interview
cons: Hr department is useless. I was given less than 24 hr notice for orientation and after 12 weeks of waiting for an orientation I gave up. There is only one individual that runs the orientation process and she is unable to comprehend that I just needed a day or two notice to rearrange my schedule to make it to orientation. She would always say she will call me right back and never did. She also could never even tell me when the next orientation might possibly be. It would be weeks between the orientations. Overall they made me reapply for the same position over and over and could not schedule me for orientation. They also expected people to be able to make a 10am orientation on a Day during the week when I was offered a job for a 4am-8am shift.

review_title: Great work-life balance, Nice values, Nice people, Nice resources/technologies and a weak , redundant middle management
job_title: Senior Strategic Marketing Analyst in Port Wentworth, GA
pros:
-FedEx has a mostly great , non-flighty attitude towards it's employees. It focuses on timeless values of "respect" and "building stability "  versus "use-and-throw" !!

- Great work/life balance 

- Good resources/advanced technologies /advanced training opportunites in Marketing for professional development.

- Good ethnic diversity !

- Internal promotion
cons:
- Weak, incompetent middle managers who were plain lucky to get promoted during the need time in early 2000.Not much leadership skills or intellectual abilities seen.

- Promotions can be based on a personal liking versus a collective / objective one.

- Rules, privileges ( such a remote working permisiion) changes from group-to-group ! Some are more equal than others.

review_title: Good people, greedy management 12-years not paid bonuses in full
pros: People first management philosophy overall. Decent work life balance. Appreciate focus on diversity and inclusion. Opportunity to move around different roles and departments.
cons: Senior executives too focused on padding their pockets at expense of managers & individual contributors. Been 12-years that haven’t paid out bonuses fully to professionals, and this year despite promising to pay out at least 50% of bonus, didn’t pay anything. Yet senior execs got their bonuses, due to earnings growth, which came at our expense.

job_title: Inside Sales Account Executive in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Great people to work with!  Good work/life balance if you know how to manage your time.  Just do your work and you will ahve a place to work for a long time.
cons: Typical corporate jibberish.  What salesforce hears from upper managerment during the rah rah sessions (middle mgt excluded) and what middle mgt is told and does is usually quite different.  I was located in AZ and the closest HR rep is 1200+ at Corp.  That can make for some interesting situations and lack of HR support.  Most of us felt like we had no advocate.

review_title: Could be a lot better, could be a lot worse....
pros: As a courier, if you put in some time, you might get a decent route. I do, and it gives me some flexibility, and I get off at a decent time most days. Managers pretty much leave you alone. Pay is not too bad. You won't get rich, but you can pay the bills.
cons: Takes 15+ years to top out. Unless you are willing to move around, no real opportunity for advancement. Even then you have to jump through hoops. It's a corp., so a lot of red tape and b.s. You are a number in the grand scheme of things. Macro-managed at times. Unrealistic goals. Profit outweighs people, and service.

review_title: Work life balance non existent for leadership
pros: Good stable company, good 401 k & vacation benefits. Company is always working hard at been the best in the market, adding services and technology.
cons: If you are in leadership, you are expected to work a lot of hours over 10 and literally walk through fire to be able to get promoted. They talk about safety as a priority but put their employees at risk expecting them to show up for work with 2 feet of snow outside. Also talk about work life balance but expect you to work 12 hour days.  Healthy benefits are the worst they ever been in 15 years.

review_title: Very few hours, and very hard to get promotions
pros: They offer good social benefits and competitive salaries
cons:
The work hours are god awful, you usually work at 4am and finish at 7am

The work ambiance is awful. New people are treated bad.

The turnover rate is ridiculous, every week we would hire at least 7 new people and by the end of the week on average only 2 people would stay

Fedex DOES NOT give references if you apply to any other companies. They will only say if you worked for FedEx

New employees are not well trained.

Dangerous work environment, many people would he stoned while operating heavy machinery inside pedestrian areas, an accident is bound to happen.

review_title: Be aware of working for Fedex,do your research. It's easy just stop a Fedex courier,on the street anytime,anywhere!
pros:
Fedex start wage is fantastic but, this is how the company suckers people in.
Fedex benefits are great as well but, beware that this is another tactic to sucker people in.
cons: The downsides to working at Fedex is simple, they are great manipulators. They tell people what they want to hear but, do the complete opposite. All Fedex cares about is their reputation, and BRAND. They treat their frontline employee's aweful but, keep in mind that these are the people that make FEDEX very rich. Overall the company has made alot of money throughout the years,  now they over work their employee's, and company expections/goals are just unreasonable to achieve.

review_title: Reputation not always a good measure opportunity.
pros: Reputable company with flexible work environment and decent benefits package.  Opportunities to work with all types of companies and customers.
cons: Opportunites for advancement in technology positions are difficult live in Memphis and know the right people. Software not as reliable as service. Some software technologies not keeping up with market.

job_title: Sales Executive Area Development in Fayetteville, AR
pros: Great Exposure to many Companies with instant credibility to get in and help them growth their business with logistics consulting.  Anyone who has the right attitude at this company will succeed.
cons: It is So Fun & Exciting  it is Hard to balance Work & Life at Home.

job_title: Operations Manager/Account Executive/Quality Assurance Manager in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: People based company.  Train well and let people make their own decisions and don't micromanage.  Excellent training and they ensure that you understand your responsibilities well.  Remove obstacles from employees so they are free and willing to go above and beyond for the customer
cons: Growing too quickly.  Acquired ground and companies split rather than remaining one solidified company.  It works well for specialization in certain areas, but leaves employees not having a well rounded understanding of everything the company has to offer the customer.

review_title: Being the best is hard work!
job_title: Performance and Planning Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: FedEx is a great place to work! Everyone here works for a common goal "To make a customer experience outstanding" via the FedEx Purple Promise.  Also, there's so many opportunities to grow in the company. I've been employed here for 2 years and 11 months and have been promoted 3 times.  The opportunities are endless, you just have to put yourself out there and strive to be the best becasue you are representing the best.
cons: The only downside is that upper management is what I consider to be "old school". I think it's high time to let some of the younger professionals take a shot at making this great company even greater.  I feel that fresh ideas is what's needed to get through our current economic crisis.

pros: No other jobs out there right now and there's stll a lot of potential, if the company will just begin listening to those of us who know how to grow the business.  The people who are left are still just as dedicated as they ever were and it is a privilege to work with them.
cons: Pay cuts, layoffs, benefits reductions, poor strategic decisions, idiotic tactical decisions, and a leadership in personal survival mode with no concept of long-term planning.

pros: Very employee friendly. You will get to work with a very smart, highly efficient set of co-workers without a cut-throat environment.
cons: Since most people dont leave FedEx after joining, promotions become more difficult. Although the company has a policy for promoting from within, it is highly competitive and almost like an internal job application rather than an automatic promotion based on superior performance. Due to this, your "interviewing skills" and ability to "sell yourself" become as important, if not more, than the job skills necessary to suceed in the new position. Not a bad thing necessarily.

review_title: Work is fast paced, managers are cool, little hours, good pay.
job_title: Package Handler Part-time in South Houston, TX
pros:
Benefits, Fed Ex pays at most a weeks vacation. If you are a student you have the opportunity to apply for tuition reimbursement, but you must be passing classes. 
Managers are understanding and are cool if you ask for a day off, like most jobs though you can't be missing too much days.
cons: Work is fast paced, you have constant work. The part time job of 24 hours weekly feels like a full time job at times because of the hard labor. If you go for a quick break to the restroom the boxes pile up and you have to work even faster to catch up.

job_title: Account Executive in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Good pay and a fairly good bonus package.
cons: Horrible Management and dishonest Human Resources Department. They shared confidential and privileged information on a EEOC complaint that was filed against those who the complaint was about   Those accused Managers retaliated and nothing could stop them. Filing more complaints resulted in complete dishonesty and falsification on FedEx's HR Department.  This needs to be investigated by the Justice Department . Documented facts have now been given to attorneys in two other lawsuits against FedEx.  I will continue to pursue this as I am currently a FedEx stock holder and will take this public. In Utah it is legal to have a secret recording device. I have more than several recordings of FedEx Management making illegal comments.   I would suggest anyone having Management issues with FedEx middle Management take a recording device into any and all meeting with those Managers. Protect  yourself  and if you have issues file with the Justice Department.

pros: Health benefits are reasonable and inexpensive.
cons: FedEx managers sit in their air conditioned offices while the slaves work in 90+ degree heat in the warehouse; the use of 'Team Leaders' as their gestapo is demeaning. They are not management but think and act like they are especially with their radios on loudly they are intimidating.  The senior employees strut around like rockstars and don't work.  You can tell the slackers from the workers  by their weight. Most millennials love the job because of the short hours and 'getting paid to work out'' attitude...did I mention that safety is a joke; it's very easy to get hurt by fast moving freight coming down the chutes or by hotdogging forklift drivers... Sunday hours suck (8pm to 230AM) and you work your tail off from clockin to clockout.  You get one FedEx T shirt as a uniform.  Sort management easily gets overwhelmed if there are delays in the operation....which happens alot in the freight world.  Inexperience abounds. If you live in your parents' basement, this is the job for you !!

review_title: Frontline Employees are not happy at FedEx
pros: It's a steady job.All I can think of
cons: The numbers,you are inundated with numbers,go faster,work harder but the pay never catches up to the work. Different parts of the state make different amounts according to cost of living but the cost of living has drastically gone up but Fedex still hasn't done anything about it. You have satisfied employees but they are not front-line employees,no matter what you do at Fedex the public recognizes the Drivers for Fedex no one else.15 years it takes to get to maximum pay at Fedex,UPS 36 months. When the Unions come into Fedex which they will,Fedex will have no one to blame but itself.

review_title: At Least I Have a Job and Healthcare
pros:
Healthcare
Don't have to interact with customers or anyone I don't feel like talking to
Physical job that keeps me toned
I am employed which is more than many can say
cons:
Ever shortening shifts
Dangerous work conditions like bad drivers on tugs and who-knows-what coming down the line (hazardous materials; poorly wrapped packages; broken glass)
Incompetent management
Lazy and intellectually challenged co-workers
No mobility, just fake lateral moves
Healthcare is way too expensive, $100/week for the family plan.

review_title: Another "used to be a good place to work" company...
pros:
Insurance but as of 2015 because of Obamacare that benefit is gone...
Company has a small pension...
cons: PAY!  I have been with them for over 8 years and only those who have been around 17 or more years have competetive pay.  In 8 years I've gotten one raise for over 2% and as a company we had gone for 1.5 years with no raise at all...keep in mind this company does quite well.  Raises are not based on merit.  The formula changes every year with the majority getting 2% if at all.  New hires make very close to what an 8 year veteran does.  Dangerous Goods reps get no extra monies for the responsibility and are held accountable.  The management training program, for couriers who want to be a manager,  is a joke and it is done entirely on the candidates personal time...Fed Ex will not pay for any training or travel expenses. They are expert at taking an excellent employee and destroying that employees attitude!

job_title: Business Applications Advisor in Memphis, TN
pros: Best location in Memphis, TN to work as an IT professional.  Atmosphere is very casual.  Basically, employees can do what they want, but that isn't always a good thing.  Employees never feel too greatly pressured.  Most management is very hands off.  Company offers a very good balance between work and life.  If you have a sick child, take off.  No questions.  If you have a family emergency, take off.  No questions asked.
cons:
Compensation is good for the area but not on par with other world class companies.
Benefits are sub-par for a company with 500K+ employees.
Senior/Executive Management is pathetic.
Lots of employees take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere and don't get their work done and it falls to other people.  The folks doing the extra work don't get compensated accordingly and the folks not doing the work don't get "punished".

pros: Independent, hands-on shifts make time fly. (Pickup route) The majority of your time is spent running your route in your truck, interacting with consistent regulars and daily on-calls.
cons: You have the same window of time to complete all stops in your area assigned to you that day. That means that, while sometimes you will have plenty of time to complete a few stops, other times you will have too many to keep up with. If you don't manage to complete all your assigned stops on time, you are penalized.

pros:
Flat organization
Lots of freedom
Easy access to hierarchy

Your opinion is valued
cons:
Difficult to manage people due to lack of boundaries on responsibilities, freedom, discipline expected.
People belonging to one team are typically spread over different countries, it's a challenge to manage different personalities, located in different countries, with different cultural backgrounds and very different levels of skills.
Management tends to overthink and avoid taking decisions.
