cons: TOO MANY FORMS!!  It seems like there are four hundred forms to fill out every time you want to make a change to your employee account, or your benefits, or your schedule.  Nothing is easy.  There are also rampant conerns about acquisitions and the opportunities afforded by them.  Too many chiefs and not enough indians it would seem like.

pros: Friendly culture.  Strong brand.  Good work-life balance.  Nice training opportunities.  Solid career advancement opportunities.  Good opportunities to work in a number of divisions.  Good benefit package overall.  Good salary comparable to other companies of similar size.  Pension plan.
cons: Poorly orchestrated layoffs.  Bureacracy given the size of the company.  Working alongside poor performers.  Minimal incentives for strong performance.  Poor HR division.  Very conservative legal department that slowed everything down or prevents things from moving forward.

pros:
-Start off making $11.90/hr. Overtime is like $18+/hr. Raises come every 3-12 months
-Easy work moving boxes/mail if you're in good shape
-Get a personal workout everyday (you will sweat & work most muscles in your body but its worth it and you'll feel great, make sure to stretch 
-Nice hours, only 3-4 a day unless you do overtime
-Complimentary Uniform/boots 
-Vision/Dental/Medical benefits after 3months
-College tuition assistance & reimbursement
-Retirement Plan
-Good working environment
-Resembles a small city 
-Complimentary food catered every few months
-Security
cons:
-Gets very hot in unairconditioned work areas esp. In the summer
-Hours (start time & end time) are different everyday so you have to call a hotline in the mornings

review_title: Could be great, but too many old heads at the helm
pros: Great benefits, good pay, decent bonus, excellent resume booster.
cons: Extremely antiquated systems (I mean, they don't even teach the programming language anymore), tenure is valued over innovation, too many in leadership who refuse to retire which creates a bottleneck for younger people who want to grow with the company. There is a reason that millennials and generation X'ers are exiting the company en masse; look at the root cause and DO something to address it.

pros: Great brand, easy to get customer meetings, product easy to sell because we can genuinely help small businesses improve and save, overall good company culture, good expense accounts for customer entertaining
cons: Underpaid in a bull market --  new bonus structure (rolled out in 2017) cuts quarterly bonuses by thousands,  internal partners are mostly incompetent making getting admin work done very hard, not enough reward and incentive for selling, sales salary is very low compared to sales job averages, SO much customer service on the shoulders of sales  - hard to delegate.

pros: People are the focus for FedEx, you always feel that the company cares about you. This is also a very customer centric compnay so we will bend over backwards to make customers happy and FedEx rewards employees for doing that.
cons: As any large corporation, there is bureaucracy and things are slow to get done as you have to fight for resources. Currently due to bad ecomony there are no carreer opportunites at FedEx, it is in a so-called 'hiring freeze'. Memphis is another downside. This is not an exciting city and crime is bad.

review_title: People First? I don't think so!
pros: Benefits! For employee and family are quite good.
cons: Policy is KING. Even when policy is irrelevant, out dated, or diminishes the "people first" policy. FedEx also, just took away the company matching contribution on the 401K!

review_title: The pay isn't the best, but it's honest work...if you're willing to do it.
pros:
- Great co-workers. All of them were friendly and hard-working, and willing to help out. 
- Pay was higher than expected.
- Very relaxed atmosphere.
cons:
- Grueling requirements.
- Unreasonable requests.
- Dark and cramped spaces
- Very biased. Expected me to do more work than others due to my gender/age/etc, even though all of us were getting paid the same. 
- Too much favoritism. They would deliberately pull me off my assignment to load someone else's truck, because it was a girl and she couldn't load 150lb. tires, which I totally understand, but the favoritism was just too much sometimes.

job_title: Highest Level Individual Contributor in Memphis, TN
pros: A great place to work. Forgiving of mistakes.  My job entails using advance analytics and project management on cross functional projects. Forward looking strategic analysis. Mentoring newer employees. Team leader at times.  I truly admire about half of my management,
cons: Multiple operating companies means no unions,except for pilots, but it also means inefficiency. Changing focus multiple times during the year.  Much emphasis put on as opposed to valuing challenging ideas. Most executives children work for the company and are promoted very quickly.  Promoting within leads to group think.  Salary for the highest level individual contributors is too low.

pros:
I've worked for FedEx for five years, many of my colleagues have worked for the company over 15 years (and I have one who's been with FedEx 40 years!). I feel my pay is commiserate to my job title, our health benefits are excellent (coverage and cost) and we have a generous pension and 401(k) opportunity. 
My work / life balance is what I'd expect for a full time corporate level position and I have the opportunity to learn and explore new challenges.
cons: In my department opportunities for advancement are limited (but not at the company as a whole). And we have a low morale issue due primarily to poor vendor management and a few very very negative employees (they are never happy).

pros: The benefits are impressive and promotion opportunities are there if you're willing to wait. There are not too many companies that offer full health and dental insurance to even the lowest level employees. The continuous assessment of performance can be either a positive or negative.
cons: Stress. Promotions are based mostly on seniority. The hours required to actually meet standards far exceed a normal working week. Employee turnover is especially high if you work in the logistics department. Some of the employees seem to be barely conscious neanderthals or are super gung ho military types who get far too excited about getting a truck to Memphis on time.

pros: The benefits are impressive and promotion opportunities are there if you're willing to wait. There are not too many companies that offer full health and dental insurance to even the lowest level employees. The continuous assessment of performance can be either a positive or negative.
cons: Stress. Promotions are based mostly on seniority. The hours required to actually meet standards far exceed a normal working week. Employee turnover is especially high if you work in the logistics department. Some of the employees seem to be barely conscious neanderthals or are super gung ho military types who get far too excited about getting a truck to Memphis on time.

review_title: FedEx reminds me of a dysfunctional but loving family... for the most part, it's great, until the doors are closed.
job_title: Senior Software Analyst in Maitland, FL
pros: FedEx is stable and tries to keep employees best interests at heart. They offer reasonably competitive pay and benefits. There is pride in the brand, even among employees.
cons: FedEx can be political and two-faced... the company seems much more concerned about their reputation to the public (shareholders) and sometimes shoots itself in the foot. Also, FedEx has become very bureaucratic and more of a popularity game, rather than truly rewarding innovation and hard work. The employee has become more disposable over the years, though, admittedly, it's still better than most companies.

review_title: Small part in a very large organization with somewhat limited scope, but many good things about company.
job_title: Marketing Specialist Advisor in Memphis, TN
pros: Work conditions.  Safety.  Facilities.  Adequate tools to do the job.  Convenience.  Sufficient flexibility.
cons: Limited income growth.  Pay scales not rationalized.  The real inside track is not always known.  Very challenging competition.  Lots of outstanding talent and intelligence, but sometimes lacking in real and broad experience, especially experience in Transportation.

job_title: Home Delivery Driver in Saint Rose, LA
pros: Good pay, meeting interesting people.
cons: Delivery drivers seems to e the only ones who are held accountable for doing their job. The freight drivers that travel between statio can show up as they  well please, which cause us to be dispatched late( sometimes as late as 10 oclock). Station manergers and their sidepieces (women) are not in anything but their bounuses. And working for a contractor sometimes means lack of flexability to take time off in an emergency.

pros: Keeps you in shape. They will give you benefits after a year. Education benefits. Other company benefits listed on the websites. Struggling to think of pros.
cons: I don't enjoy getting hurt and receiving cuts and bruises on my body on a daily basis. No matter how safe I try to be, It happens. I don't care if it's minor cuts and bruises here and there. I didn't like this job because I didn't like the lifting, as a former UPS employee, I found that working at the unloading area at their "new state of the art building" was more difficult than the much older UPS ups hub.

review_title: Give credit, where credit is due.
pros: After 15 years, I can't think of one!  OK, maybe one?  The benifits are pretty good.
cons: Quit and never go back.  If, you do, you will be treated as IF you are a NEW employee.  However, you can climb up the ladder faster with all that knowledge, but the pay will NOT!!  The best job within FedEx where the pay is ok was a courier.  After so many years on the road, my body couldn't keep up and so, i chose to quit instead of working as a CSR in the call center or in a BSC (pay cut to go in doors at FedEx) and at that time was not an option being a single parent.

review_title: FedEx truly a first class company
job_title: Senior Project Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros:
The best reasons to work for Fedex include the following:
-The ability to work for a great company
-The experience of working for a top notch organization
-Great name for building your resume
-Great benefits and competitive pay
-Everyone knows what FedEx does
-For the most part, people are truly valued by the company
-Work/life balance is good
cons:
The downsides to working at Fedex include the following:
-Career opportunities are limited because people in management rarely leave FedEx
-Some questionable people in management
-Employee development could use improvement
-Memphis is not the best of cities to work and live in

review_title: Excellent place to work but driven individuals beware!
pros: Excellent camaraderie with other employees, job security, excellent benefits, very ethical company.  I'm proud to work at FedEx.
cons: There are a large number of employees that aren't carrying their fair share of the workload.  While this is encouraging for some, because of job security, it is very discouraging for those that really want to contribute to FedEx's success.  It can be demoralizing to see other's that aren't contributing as much getting the same recognition and compensation as those that strive hard to do an excellent job.

review_title: Great company, challenging work, decent salary.
job_title: Senior Marketing Specialist in Memphis, TN
pros: Challenging work. Committed team members. Generous benefits. FedEx is a strong believer in positive reinforcement. They often make the top of best places to work lists because they treat their employees very fairly. Respect, diversity, and cooperation are heavily favored.
cons: Limited short-term promotion opportunity. Heavy workload. Politics. Employees come from all over the country to work here for the opportunity to work for this very well respected company and they tend to stay for a very long time. Most promotion is from within but opportunity is limited due to very low turnover and high satisfaction. Great opportunity if you plan on staying in Memphis for 10 + years. Hard to advance in shorter periods of time.

review_title: Perfect for College student who wants to earn fast cash or turn in to a career in the future
job_title: Package Handler in San Diego, CA
pros: Good Pay and Hours, advancements are available based on your performance, including time. In my facility, managers are awesome! treats their workers right. If you do not have a gym membership, treat this job as a work out! and getting paid at the same time!
cons: So far there are no Cons, other than people calling out and have to pick up the slacks. This is a very physical demanding job, so if you don't mind sweating and getting sore, this job is perfect! You eventually get used to it.
